Simcore

SimManager

class mojograsp.simcore.sim_manager.SimManager

SimManager Abstract Base Class

abstract add_phase(phase_name: str, phase_object: Phase, start: bool = False)

Method takes in a phase name, phase object and a boolean to specify whether it is the starting phase. Adds the phase to the phase manager

Parameters

  • phase_name (str) – Name of the phase being added.

  • phase (Phase()) – Phase() object.

  • start (bool) – If True then the phase given will be the starting phase.

abstract run()

Method begins the episode and phase loop until all episodes are completed

abstract stall()

Helper method to keep sim open for inspection and stalled until window is closed

class mojograsp.simcore.sim_manager.SimManagerDefault(num_episodes: int = 1, env: ~mojograsp.simcore.environment.Environment = <mojograsp.simcore.environment.EnvironmentDefault object>, episode: ~mojograsp.simcore.episode.Episode = <mojograsp.simcore.episode.EpisodeDefault object>, record_data: ~mojograsp.simcore.record_data.RecordData = <mojograsp.simcore.record_data.RecordDataDefault object>)

Default SimManager class, runs through all episodes and uses the passed in mojograsp classes to call the necessary functions. This default will work for any non RL application.

add_phase(phase_name: str, phase: Phase, start: bool = False)

Method takes in a phase name, phase object and a boolean to specify whether it is the starting phase. Adds the phase to the phase manager

Parameters

  • phase_name (str) – Name of the phase being added.

  • phase (Phase()) – Phase() object.

  • start (bool) – If True then the phase given will be the starting phase.

run()

Runs through all episodes, and the phases in each episode, continues until all episodes are completed. Calls the user defined phases and other classes inherited from the abstract base classes. Detailed diagram is above of the order of operations.

stall()

Helper method to keep sim open for inspection and stalled until window is closed

class mojograsp.simcore.sim_manager.SimManagerRL(num_episodes: int = 1, env: ~mojograsp.simcore.environment.Environment = <mojograsp.simcore.environment.EnvironmentDefault object>, episode: ~mojograsp.simcore.episode.Episode = <mojograsp.simcore.episode.EpisodeDefault object>, record_data: ~mojograsp.simcore.record_data.RecordData = <mojograsp.simcore.record_data.RecordDataDefault object>, replay_buffer: ~mojograsp.simcore.replay_buffer.ReplayBuffer = <class 'mojograsp.simcore.replay_buffer.ReplayBufferDefault'>)

SimManagerRL class, runs through all episodes and uses the passed in mojograsp classes to call the necessary functions. This default will work on most RL applications.

add_phase(phase_name: str, phase: Phase, start: bool = False)

Method takes in a phase name, phase object and a boolean to specify whether it is the starting phase. Adds the phase to the phase manager

Parameters

  • phase_name (str) – Name of the phase being added.

  • phase (Phase()) – Phase() object.

  • start (bool) – If True then the phase given will be the starting phase.

run()

Runs through all episodes, and the phases in each episode, continues until all episodes are completed. Calls the user defined phases and other classes inherited from the abstract base classes. Detailed diagram is above of the order of operations.

stall()

Helper method to keep sim open for inspection and stalled until window is closed

Phase

class mojograsp.simcore.phase.Phase

Phase Abstract Base Class

abstract execute_action()

This method is called every step by SimManager() while the currrent phase is active. Operations such as moving joints and executing actions should be done here.

abstract exit_condition() → bool

This method is called by SimManager() every Phase iteration and returns either a Boolean, signifying if the current phase should end or continue looping. Returning True signifies that the current phase should end and function next_phase() should be called. Any exit conditions for a phase should be kept here.

Returns

True (exit phase) or False (continue phase).

Return type

bool

abstract next_phase() → str

This method is called by SimManager() once a phase has returned True for its exit_condition(). Returns a string specifying the next phase that the PhaseManager() should transition to next. To signify the end of an episode return None.

Returns

The name of the next phase or None

Return type

str or None

abstract post_step()

This method is called after every step by SimManager() while the currrent phase is active.

abstract pre_step()

This method is called before every step by SimManager() while the currrent phase is active.

abstract setup()

This method is called by SimManager() once before the phase begins.

PhaseManager

class mojograsp.simcore.phase_manager.PhaseManager

Phase Manager Class

add_phase(phase_name: str, phase: Phase, start=False)

Method takes in a phase name, phase object and a boolean to specify whether it is the starting phase. Adds the phase to the phase dictionary in the style PHASE_NAME: PHASE_OBJECT.

Parameters

  • phase_name (str) – Name of the phase being added.

  • phase (Phase()) – Phase() object.

  • start (bool) – If True then the phase given will be the starting phase.

get_exit_flag() → bool

Gets the internal exit flag so that SimManager() can check if all phases are complete

get_next_phase()

Method called by SimManager() to get the next phase after the current one has completed. If no phase is given or phase name does not exist in the phase dictionary then the phase manager terminates.

set_exit_flag(val: bool = False)

Allows SimManager() to manually set the exit flag after a run is completed for the next episode.

setup()

Method called before starting episodes by SimManager(), sets the current phase to the starting phase

Environment

class mojograsp.simcore.environment.Environment

Environment Abstract Base Class

abstract reset()

This method is called by SimManager() before every episode. It should be used to reset any sim objects before a new episode begins and optionally reload and reset pybullet before each episode.

abstract setup()

This method is called by SimManager() once before an episode begins.

abstract step()

This method is called by SimManager() to step pybullet, currently the default is a step every 1/240 seconds. Changing step size, length, etc. should be done here.

class mojograsp.simcore.environment.EnvironmentDefault
reset()

Default Placeholder if no Environment class is provided

setup()

Default Placeholder if no Environment class is provided

step()

Calls default step method in parent Environment().

Episode

class mojograsp.simcore.episode.Episode

Episode Abstract Base Class

abstract post_episode()

This method is called by SimManager() once after an episode ends.

abstract setup()

This method is called by SimManager() once before an episode begins.

class mojograsp.simcore.episode.EpisodeDefault
post_episode()

Default Placeholder if no Episode class is provided

setup()

Default Placeholder if no Episode class is provided

RecordData

class mojograsp.simcore.record_data.RecordData

Record Data Abstract Base Class

abstract record_episode()

Method is called after every episode by SimManager() and records all of the given timesteps for an episode.

abstract record_timestep()

Method is called every timestep by SimManager() to record the State, Action and Reward (if given).

abstract save_all()

Method called after all episodes are completed, optionally condenses and saves all episodes to an output file

abstract save_episode()

Method called after record_episode(), optionally saves the previous episode output to a file.

class mojograsp.simcore.record_data.RecordDataDefault
record_episode()

Default Placeholder if no RecordData class is provided

record_timestep()

Default Placeholder if no RecordData class is provided

save_all()

Default Placeholder if no RecordData class is provided

save_episode()

Default Placeholder if no RecordData class is provided

class mojograsp.simcore.record_data.RecordDataJSON(data_path: ~typing.Optional[str] = None, data_prefix: str = 'episode', save_all=False, save_episode=True, state: ~mojograsp.simcore.state.State = <mojograsp.simcore.state.StateDefault object>, action: ~mojograsp.simcore.action.Action = <mojograsp.simcore.action.ActionDefault object>, reward: ~mojograsp.simcore.reward.Reward = <mojograsp.simcore.reward.RewardDefault object>)

RecordDataJSON Class (Optional default class for recording data to json files)

record_episode()

Method called by SimManager() after every episode. Compiles all of the timestep dictionaries into a list and adds it to the episode dicionary.

record_timestep()

Method called by SimManager() every timestep. Records the user defined state, action, and reward. Saves the result to a timestep dictionary which is later used to form an episode.

save_all()

Method called by SimManager() after all episodes are completed. Saves all episode dictionaries to a json file.

save_episode()

Method called by SimManager() after every episode. Saves the most recent episode dictionary to a json file.

ReplayBuffer

class mojograsp.simcore.replay_buffer.ReplayBuffer

ReplayBuffer Abstract Base Class

abstract add_timestep(episode_num: int, timestep_num: int)

Method required to add a timestep to the replay buffer, must specify the episode number and the timestep number. These are both given by the SimManager().

Parameters

  • episode_num (int) – corresponding episode number of the timestep.

  • timestep_num (int) – corresponding timestep number.

abstract save_buffer(filename: str)

Method to save the resulting buffer to an output file.

Parameters

filename – file path to save the result.

class mojograsp.simcore.replay_buffer.Timestep(episode: Optional[int] = None, timestep: Optional[int] = None, state: Optional[dict] = None, action: Optional[dict] = None, reward: Optional[dict] = None, next_state: Optional[dict] = None)

Dataclass for holding all of the data from a timestep

State

class mojograsp.simcore.state.State

State Abstract Base Class

abstract get_state() → dict

Method should return a dictionary that represents the current state of the simulator environment BEFORE it is executed and the sim is stepped. The return value is class variable self.current_state which is updated by set_state().

Returns

Dictionary containing the representation of the current state as a dictionary

Return type

Dictionary with format {string: ANY TYPE}.

abstract set_state()

Method should be used to set the class variable self.current_state to represent the current state. It should be called by the pre_step() method of a user defined phase. This can be set however you would like, as long as self.current_action is updated so that get_action is returns properly. This could include joint angles, locations, etc.

class mojograsp.simcore.state.StateDefault(objects: Optional[list] = None)

Default State Class that is used when the user does not need or wish to use the Action class but it may still be called by other classes such as RecordData() and ReplayBufferDefault().

get_state() → dict

Default method will return a dictionary containing the the get_data() return value for every object in the objects list. If no objects are given then it returns an empty dictionary.

Returns

Dictionary containing the representation of the current simulator state or an empty dictionary.

Return type

dict

set_state()

Default method that sets self.current_state to either get_data() for the object or an empty dictionary

Action

class mojograsp.simcore.action.Action

Action Abstract Base Class

abstract get_action() → dict

Method should return a dictionary that represents the intended target action BEFORE it is executed and the sim is stepped. The return value is class variable self.current_action which is updated by set_action().

Returns

Dictionary containing the representation of an intended action for a simulator object.

Return type

Dictionary with format {string: ANY TYPE}.

abstract set_action()

Method should be used to set the class variable self.current_action. It should be called in the pre_step() method of a user defined phase. This can be set however you would like, as long as self.current_action is updated so that get_action is returns properly. This could include joint target angles, end effector targets, etc.

class mojograsp.simcore.action.ActionDefault

Default Action Class that is used when the user does not need or wish to use the Action class but it may still be called by other classes such as RecordData() and ReplayBufferDefault().

get_action() → dict

Default method that returns an empty dictionary.

Returns

An empty dictionary.

Return type

dict

set_action()

Default method that sets self.current_action to an empty dictionary.

Reward

class mojograsp.simcore.reward.Reward

Reward Abstract Base Class

abstract get_reward() → dict

Method should return a dictionary that represents the resulting reward of an action AFTER it is executed and AFTER the sim is stepped.

Returns

Dictionary containing the representation of the reward from an action

Return type

Dictionary with format {string: ANY TYPE}.

abstract set_reward()

Method should be used to set the class variable self.current_reward. It should be called in the post_step() method of a user defined phase. This can be set however you would like, as long as self.current_reward is updated so that get_reward() is returns properly. This could be distance measures, or any other metrics saved in a dictionary

class mojograsp.simcore.reward.RewardDefault

Default Reward Class that is used when the user does not need or wish to use the Reward class but it may still be called by other classes such as RecordData() and ReplayBufferDefault().

get_reward() → dict

Default method that returns an empty dictionary.

Returns

An empty dictionary.

Return type

dict

set_reward()

Default method that sets self.current_reward to an empty dictionary.
